title: Angry Locals In Mexico Tie Mayor To Truck & Drag Him On The Road That He Failed To Repair
text:
Angry Locals In Mexico Tie Mayor To Truck & Drag Him On The Road That He Failed To Repair

Angry Locals In Mexico Tie Mayor To Truck & Drag Him On The Road That He Failed To Repair

When it comes to making promises in the interest of public, officials ace the game during elections. But the problem arises during implementation.

Officials, more often than not, turn lackadaisical and fail to make amends and in such cases all that people can do is complain. Things seem to be slightly different in Mexico where recently locals decided to physically punish one official for not carrying out his duty.

Twitter

In a recent incident, angry locals decided to tie the mayor of a Mexican town to a truck and drag him on the road that he had reportedly promised to repair.

According to reports, Jorge Luis Escandón, the mayor of Las Margaritas in southern Mexico, faced the wrath of an indigenous community.

Armed with clubs, they broke into the mayor's office in the town of Las Margaritas in the state of Chiapas.

Witnesses told investigators they tied up the mayor, Jorge Luis Escandon, pushed him outside and tied him to the back of a pickup. They then dragged him several dozen meters (yards) down the street, before police and public employees intervened and freed Escandon.

It allegedly took dozens of municipal police officers to stop the vehicle and rescue the mayor.

Local reports quoted Mayor Escandon, who was unhurt in the incident, saying, 'Around 50 or 60 people came in three pickup trucks, armed with clubs and looking to kidnap city officials to extort us and get what they’ve always wanted: to be given money.'

‘They started struggling, carrying me, tied up one foot and dragged me out of my office to the street.’

This is not the first time for the people of Mexico to act rashly against government officials. Last month, Mayor of a municipality in South Mexico was paraded through town in women’s clothing for failing to keep his campaign promises.

A video of mayor Javier Jimenez walking around his town in a long dark skirt and a white blouse went viral on social media.

According to a Mexican daily, another municipal official, Luis Ton, was also dressed in traditional women’s clothing and forced to beg for money from passing motorists on the San Cristóbal-Ocosingo highway.
